intro: Perezia lechleri, commonly known as the hoja de senna, is a perennial shrub native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its dark green, waxy leaves that are rich in bioactive compounds. The plant thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found growing near rivers and in dense undergrowth. Its leaves are traditionally used in South American folk medicine for their anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. The botanical features of Perezia lechleri make it a valuable resource in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
